results.description: Use pv13_com_page_rank (high coverage/userCount). Applied SUGGESTION1 by combining PageRank with its short-term zscore momentum. SUGGESTION2: pv13_com_page_rank is a vector (competitors) so used vec_avg(). SUGGESTION3: not needed (coverage 0.8966). Kept implementation short per KEEP_IN_MINDs. Confidence set to 0.7 because PageRank of competitors often predicts relative attention spillovers.

Exploit pv13_custretsig_retsig (very high coverage). SUGGESTION1: single strong field used for robust signal. SUGGESTION2 not applicable. Coverage high so SUGGESTION3 not used. Short implementation per KEEP_IN_MIND. Confidence 0.6 due to binary nature but strong coverage.

Compare pv13_com_rk_au (authority) and pv13_ompetitorgraphrank_hub_rank (hub scores). SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Both coverage ~0.8966 so no backfill. Compute difference then cross-sectional zscore. Applied KEEP_IN_MINDs. Confidence 0.65: divergence signals structural competitor roles.
Normalize pv13_revere_index_cap by rel_num_comp to capture concentration. Both high coverage; used SUGGESTION1. KEEP_IN_MIND satisfied. Confidence 0.7: market cap per competitor signals dominance.

Use rel_ret_comp (avg competitor returns) and pv13_revere_index_value (index level) to detect relative momentum. Both have high coverage; SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.6 since cross effects noisy.
Use rel_ret_part to capture partner return spillovers. Coverage ~0.7097 so ok. SUGGESTION1 single field used; SUGGESTION3 not needed. Confidence 0.55: partners often correlated but less predictive.

Use rel_num_cust (coverage 0.5068) indicating customer base size. Because coverage <0.6 applied SUGGESTION3 ts_backfill to reduce sparsity. SUGGESTION1 used single field to keep simple. Confidence 0.5 due to sparser coverage.

rel_ret_all (avg returns of overlapping-product companies) combined with rel_num_all (count) to weight intensity. SUGGESTION1 used both fields; both high coverage so no backfill. Confidence 0.68: product-overlap returns often precede spillovers.
Track ts_delta of rel_num_comp to find growing competitive pressure. rel_num_comp high coverage; SUGGESTION1 used single field. Confidence 0.56: structural but slow-moving.

Use pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank (customers' PageRank) vector-typed; applied vec_avg per SUGGESTION2. Coverage ~0.7906 so no backfill. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.62: customer centrality indicates exposure.

Combine customers' authority score pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank (vec) with rel_ret_cust (customers' returns). rel_ret_cust coverage 0.4921 so applied ts_backfill per SUGGESTION3. SUGGESTION1 used both fields. Confidence 0.63 given network weighting improves signal.

Use pv13_ompetitorgraphrank_hub_rank (vec) and rel_ret_comp to construct hub-weighted competitor return. Coverage high so no backfill. SUGGESTION2 &1 applied. Confidence 0.66: hubs amplify competitor moves.
Use pv13_revere_key_sector_total (high userCount) to detect focused firms. SUGGESTION1 single field. Coverage 1.0 so no backfill. Confidence 0.57: focused companies sometimes outperform.
pv13_revere_term_sector_total measures terminal sector count (coverage 1.0). Used directly (SUGGESTION1). Confidence 0.52: directional but mixed.

Divide company market cap by pv13_revere_country (categorical) can't divide; instead compare ts_returns of pv13_revere_index_value (index) to company cap. Used SUGGESTION1. All high coverage. Confidence 0.6: country-level momentum matters.

Use pv13_revere_zipcode as group for regional mean of rel_ret_all; applied group_mean to capture regional spillovers per KEEP_IN_MIND4 (use as group parameter). rel_ret_all high coverage. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. Confidence 0.58.

Compare company-level rel_ret_comp to parent sector performance pv13_revere_parent (used as group). rel_ret_comp coverage high; applied group_zscore to get within-parent zscore. SUGGESTION1 and KEEP_IN_MIND4 respected. Confidence 0.61.
Subtract market index returns from average competitor returns to find relative alpha. Both fields high coverage; SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.66.
Detect sudden increase in competitors' PageRank vec_avg using ts_arg_max to see if today is recent peak. SUGGESTION2 used vec_avg. Confidence 0.64.
Multiply customers' hub score vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank) by ts_std_dev of rel_ret_cust (backfilled due to coverage<0.6). SUGGESTION1-3 applied. Confidence 0.58.
Use ts_ir on rel_ret_comp to capture persistent competitor signal. SUGGESTION1 single field high coverage. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Partner Count Normalized by Market Cap
results.description: Divide rel_num_part by pv13_revere_index_cap to see partner density relative to size. Both fields high coverage. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.59.
Second-difference (ts_delta of ts_delta) of rel_ret_comp to find acceleration of competitor returns. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.56.
Multiply vec_avg(pv13_com_rk_au) with ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp). SUGGESTION1-2 used. Confidence 0.65.
Cross-sectional quantile of rel_ret_cust (coverage <0.6 so backfilled). Used quantile per SUGGESTIONS. Confidence 0.54.
Multiply rel_num_comp by ts_returns(pv13_revere_index_value,1) to capture index sensitivity weighted by competition. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.6.
rel_num_all normalized by pv13_revere_company_total to measure overlap intensity. Coverage: rel_num_all high, pv13_revere_company_total low (0.3508) so backfilled per SUGGESTION3. Confidence 0.55.
ts_delta of pv13_revere_key_sector_total to detect recent addition/loss of sectors. Coverage 1.0 so no backfill. SUGGESTION1 simple. Confidence 0.53.
Ratio of terminal sectors to total sectors: divide pv13_revere_term_sector_total by pv13_revere_key_sector_total. Both high coverage. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.52.
vec_stddev of pv13_com_page_rank to capture spread among competitors. SUGGESTION2 applied. Coverage high. Confidence 0.6.
ts_delta of vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank) to catch rising customer centrality. SUGGESTION2 used. Confidence 0.58.
Subtract hub and authority averages for competitors to capture structural shifts. SUGGESTION2 used on both. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Market Cap Momentum Adjusted by Competitor Returns
results.description: Multiply ts_returns(pv13_revere_index_cap,5) by rel_ret_comp to find whether size momentum aligns with competitor moves. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.61.
pv13_reveremap likely indicates mapping richness; combine with rel_ret_all to find mapped-product returns. pv13_reveremap coverage 0.9926. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.5.
Use group_rank on rel_ret_comp within pv13_revere_parent to get parent-relative standing. SUGGESTION1 & KEEP_IN_MIND4 used. Confidence 0.59.
Divide ts_backfill(rel_num_cust,30) by pv13_revere_term_sector_total to find customer density in terminal-focused firms. SUGGESTION3 used for rel_num_cust. Confidence 0.48 (data sparser).
Use ts_kurtosis or ts_kurtosis of rel_ret_comp to find tail risk among competitors. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.46 (higher noise).
Multiply vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank) by rel_num_comp to weight count by importance. SUGGESTION1-2 used. Confidence 0.63.
Multiply vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank) with ts_zscore(ts_returns(ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,30),1),20). SUGGESTION2 and 3 used. Confidence 0.6.
quantile(rel_ret_comp) to capture where company sits among peers. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.62.
Subtract rel_ret_comp from rel_ret_part to see whether partners outperform competitorsâ€”spillover predictor. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.57.
ts_decay_linear(rel_ret_comp, 20) to capture decayed past returns. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.55.
Multiply vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank) by ts_zscore(ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,30),20). SUGGESTION1-3 applied. Confidence 0.59.
group_zscore(pv13_revere_index_cap, pv13_revere_parent) to measure firm size within parent sector. SUGGESTION1 & KEEP_IN_MIND4 used. Confidence 0.64.
vec_range(pv13_com_page_rank) captures heterogeneity of competitor importance. SUGGESTION2 used. Confidence 0.6.
Compare ts_delta(rel_num_cust,30) to ts_zscore(rel_ret_cust) after backfill. SUGGESTION3 used for rel_num_cust/rel_ret_cust. Confidence 0.52.
quantile(vec_avg(pv13_com_rk_au)) for cross-sectional ranking of authority. SUGGESTION2 &1 applied. Confidence 0.6.
ts_zscore(ts_delta(rel_num_part,30),60) to capture accelerating partnerships. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.54.
ts_delta(pv13_revere_index_value,1) minus rel_ret_comp to extract surprise. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.58.
Divide ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,30) by pv13_revere_index_cap to get return intensity per size. SUGGESTION3 used for rel_ret_cust. Confidence 0.51.
ts_zscore(rel_ret_all, 10) to capture momentum across overlapping-product firms. SUGGESTION1 used single strong field. Confidence 0.6.
Divide rel_num_comp by pv13_revere_term_sector_total to capture competitive intensity in terminal-focused firms. pv13_revere_term_sector_total coverage 1.0. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.53.
Subtract vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank) from vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_hub_rank) to detect structural shift in customer network. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.56.
vec_count of competitors with page rank above threshold via tail(bucket) not allowed; use vec_avg and rel_num_comp to approximate. SUGGESTION2 used. Confidence 0.49 due to approximation.
Multiply pv13_reveremap by rel_ret_comp to capture mapped competitor returns. Both high coverage. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.5.

results.idea: Competitor Return Normalized by Parent Size
results.description: Divide rel_ret_comp by group_mean(pv13_revere_index_cap, pv13_revere_parent) to normalize returns by parent-scale. KEEP_IN_MIND4 used group. Confidence 0.62.
Use vec_avg of competitors' page rank (pv13_com_page_rank) as proxy for partner network importance multiplied by rel_ret_part. SUGGESTION1-2 used. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Customer Return Volatility vs Company Size
results.description: Divide ts_std_dev(ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,30),20) by pv13_revere_index_cap to detect risky small firms with volatile customers. SUGGESTION3 used. Confidence 0.47.
Add normalized rel_num_comp and rel_num_all to get combined pressure. SUGGESTION1 used two counts. Confidence 0.58.
reverse(ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp, 10)) to bet on reversion if overly high. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.53.
vec_range of customer PageRank to measure concentration; SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.55.
zscore(rel_ret_part) giving cross-sectional signal for partners. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.54.
ts_delta(vec_avg(pv13_com_rk_au), 14) to detect rising authority among competitors. SUGGESTION2 used. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Index Value vs Parent Sector Activity
results.description: Compare ts_returns(pv13_revere_index_value,5) to group_mean(rel_ret_comp, pv13_revere_parent). KEEP_IN_MIND4 used for group. Confidence 0.59.
group_std_dev(rel_ret_comp, pv13_revere_parent) to measure dispersion within parent. KEEP_IN_MIND4 used. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Customers Return vs Competitor Return Gap
results.description: Subtract rel_ret_comp from ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,30) and zscore. SUGGESTION3 used for rel_ret_cust. Confidence 0.53.
ts_arg_max(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank), 5) to see recent spikes in competitor importance. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.58.
group_count(rel_num_comp, pv13_revere_parent) to measure competitor density at parent level. KEEP_IN_MIND4 used. Confidence 0.55.
Multiply vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank) by ts_delta(ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,30),3). SUGGESTION2 &3 used. Confidence 0.57.
Subtract pv13_revere_index_cap zscore from vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank) zscore to spot small firms with central competitors. SUGGESTION2 &1 used. Confidence 0.6.
Divide rel_ret_part by rel_ret_comp to understand whether partners outperform competitors. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.56.
Use single_sector_pureplay_company_count (coverage 0.3508) backfilled to measure pure-play competition. Applied ts_backfill per SUGGESTION3. Confidence 0.45 (sparser).
Multiply vec_avg(pv13_com_rk_au) by ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp, 5). SUGGESTION2 used. Confidence 0.64.
group_sum(ts_backfill(rel_num_cust,30), pv13_revere_zipcode) to aggregate customers by zipcode group. SUGGESTION3 used for backfill and KEEP_IN_MIND4 for group. Confidence 0.5.

results.idea: Competitor Return Momentum vs Company Map
results.description: Multiply rel_ret_comp by pv13_reveremap to see mapped competitor momentum. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Index Cap Growth vs Competitor Count
results.description: ts_delta(pv13_revere_index_cap,30) divided by rel_num_comp to get growth per competitor. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.58.
ts_arg_min(vec_avg(pv13_ompetitorgraphrank_hub_rank), 10) to find recent peaks/troughs. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.55.
days_from_last_change(vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank)) to measure stability of customer centrality. SUGGESTION2 used. Confidence 0.51.
vec_sum(pv13_com_page_rank) ts_delta to capture aggregate attention spikes. SUGGESTION2 used. Confidence 0.59.
Divide rel_num_part by pv13_revere_term_sector_total to detect partnerships concentration in terminal sectors. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.49.
group_zscore(rel_ret_comp, pv13_revere_key_sector_total) to compare competitor returns by sector focus. KEEP_IN_MIND4 used. Confidence 0.6.
zscore(ts_std_dev(ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,30),20)) to capture customer-return dispersion cross-sectionally. SUGGESTION3 used. Confidence 0.48.
divide vec_avg(pv13_com_rk_au) by add(vec_avg(pv13_ompetitorgraphrank_hub_rank),1e-6) to see dominance type. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.61.
Divide rel_num_all by pv13_reveremap (backfill not needed). SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.47.
ts_ir(rel_ret_comp, 30) as rolling information ratio for competitor returns. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.6.
group_zscore(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank), pv13_revere_parent) to see relative competitor prominence within parent. SUGGESTION2 & KEEP_IN_MIND4 used. Confidence 0.62.
multiply vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank) with rel_ret_part to capture customer network impact on partner returns. SUGGESTION1-2 used. Confidence 0.56.
zscore(rel_num_comp) simple cross-sectional signal. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.5.

results.idea: Competitor Return Relative Rank in Zipcode
results.description: group_rank(rel_ret_comp, pv13_revere_zipcode) to rank within geographic clusters. KEEP_IN_MIND4 used. Confidence 0.53.
multiply(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank), ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,30)) combining competitor centrality and customer returns; SUGGESTION2 &3 used. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Competitor Return Momentum Normalized by Count
results.description: divide(ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp,10), add(rel_num_comp,1)) to normalize momentum by competitor count. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.57.
ts_arg_max(vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank), 7) to find recent authority spikes among customers. SUGGESTION2 used. Confidence 0.56.
subtract(rel_ret_comp, pv13_reveremap) to see if returns exceed mapping density expectations. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.49.

divide(group_sum(pv13_revere_term_sector_total, pv13_revere_parent), group_sum(pv13_revere_key_sector_total, pv13_revere_parent)) using group_sum to aggregate then ratio; KEEP_IN_MIND4 respected. Confidence 0.5.
ts_delay(ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,30),1) as a 1-day leading/backfilled customer return. SUGGESTION3 used. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Competitor PageRank vs Terminal Sector Count
results.description: multiply(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank), pv13_revere_term_sector_total) to find high-attention competitors in terminal firms. SUGGESTION2 used. Confidence 0.54.

results.idea: Relatively High Market Cap with Few Competitors
results.description: divide(pv13_revere_index_cap, add(rel_num_comp,1)) and take cross-sectional zscore. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.63.
reverse(ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp,3)) to capture short-term reversals. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.5.
multiply(vec_avg(pv13_com_rk_au), vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank)) combining competitor authority and customer centrality. SUGGESTION2 used on both vectors. Confidence 0.62.

results.idea: Partner Return Momentum vs Company Size
results.description: divide(ts_zscore(rel_ret_part,10), pv13_revere_index_cap) to find small firms with partner momentum. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.5.

group_std_dev(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank), pv13_revere_parent) to measure within-parent concentration of competitor attention. Used group operator per KEEP_IN_MIND4. SUGGESTION2+4 applied. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Customers Return vs Partner Return Spread
results.description: subtract(rel_ret_part, ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,30)) and zscore. SUGGESTION3 used. Confidence 0.51.
ts_std_dev(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank), 20) to capture fluctuations in average competitor attention. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Key Sector Count vs Competitor Count
results.description: divide(pv13_revere_key_sector_total, add(rel_num_comp,1)) to find firms with broader focus relative to competition. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.54.
kth_element not allowed with single operator count constraints; approximate with ts_rank(rel_ret_comp,30) as momentum rank. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.45.

results.idea: High Mapping with Low Competitor Count
results.description: subtract(zscore(pv13_reveremap), zscore(rel_num_comp)) to find well-mapped niche firms. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.48.

results.idea: Customers Authority vs Competitor Authority Gap
results.description: subtract(vec_avg(pv13_com_rk_au), vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_auth_rank)) to see whether competitors are more authoritative than customers. SUGGESTION2 applied. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Competitor Return Trend vs Parent Index
results.description: subtract(ts_zscore(rel_ret_comp,20), ts_zscore(ts_returns(pv13_revere_index_value,5),20)) SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.57.
add(vec_avg(pv13_com_rk_au), vec_avg(pv13_ompetitorgraphrank_hub_rank)) to form combined centrality. SUGGESTION2 used. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Customers PageRank vs Zipcode Mean Return
results.description: subtract(vec_avg(pv13_ustomergraphrank_page_rank), group_mean(rel_ret_all, pv13_revere_zipcode)) keeping group usage per KEEP_IN_MIND4. SUGGESTION2 &1 applied. Confidence 0.53.
ts_sum(rel_ret_comp,3) short-horizon cumulative competitor return as signal. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.56.
approximate partner centrality using vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank) times rel_num_part. SUGGESTION2 &1 used. Confidence 0.5.
subtract(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank), ts_mean(vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank), 30)) to see underperforming competitor attention. SUGGESTION2 used. Confidence 0.57.
ts_sum(ts_backfill(rel_ret_cust,30), 7) to capture weekly customer-return sum with backfill applied. SUGGESTION3 used. Confidence 0.5.

results.idea: Competitor Count Momentum Weighted by PageRank
results.description: multiply(ts_delta(rel_num_comp,30), vec_avg(pv13_com_page_rank)) using SUGGESTION1-2. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Key Sector Count vs Terminal Sector Ratio
results.description: divide(pv13_revere_key_sector_total, add(pv13_revere_term_sector_total,1e-6)) simple structural ratio. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.47.

results.idea: Competitor Return Rolling Max Drawdown Proxy
results.description: ts_max_diff(rel_ret_comp, 30) to capture drawdown relative to 30-day peak. SUGGESTION1 used. Confidence 0.49.
